intro: Grumilea kwaiensis, commonly known as the Kwaiensis grumilea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture.
